acmCardList.name: Myeong Dong
acmCardList.desc: Myeongdong (Korean: Î™ÖÎèô, Hanja: ÊòéÊ¥û; lit. 'bright cave' or 'bright tunnel') is a dong in Jung-gu, Seoul, South Korea between Chungmu-ro, Eulji-ro, and Namdaemun-ro. It covers 0.99km¬≤ with a population of 3,409 and is mostly a commercial area, being one of Seoul's main shopping, parade route and tourism districts. In 2011, 2012 and 2013, Myeong-dong was listed as the ninth most expensive shopping street in the world. The area is known for its two historically significant sites, namely the Myeongdong Cathedral and the Myeongdong Nanta Theatre.

acmCardList.name: Hong Dae
acmCardList.desc: Hongdae (Korean: ÌôçÎåÄ; Hanja: ÂºòÂ§ß) is a neighborhood in Seoul, South Korea near Hongik University, after which it is named. It is known for its urban arts and indie music culture, local shops, clubs and entertainment. The area is located in Mapo-gu in the western end of Seoul, stretching from Seogyo-dong to Hapjeong-dong.

acmCardList.name: Gang Nam
acmCardList.desc: Gangnam District (/Àà…°√¶≈ãn√¶m, Àà…°…ëÀê≈ãn…ëÀêm/; Korean: Í∞ïÎÇ®Íµ¨; Hanja: Ê±üÂçóÂçÄ; RR: Gangnam-gu, Korean pronunciation: [ka≈ã nam gu]) is one of the 25 local government districts which make up the city of Seoul, South Korea. Gangnam literally means 'South of the (Han) River'. Gangnam District is the third largest district in Seoul, with an area of 39.5 km2 (15.3 sq mi). As of the 2017 census, Gangnam District had a population of 561,052. There is a high concentration of wealth in the district with prices for an apartment as of 2020 having risen by 83 times in 40 years compared to just 6 times in the rest of Seoul.

acmCardList.name: Dongdaemun
acmCardList.desc: Dongdaemun District (Korean: ÎèôÎåÄÎ¨∏Íµ¨, romanized: Dongdaemun-gu, 'Great Eastern Gate') is one of the 25 districts of Seoul, South Korea. Dongdaemun has a population of 346,770 (2010) and has a geographic area of 14.22 km2 (5.49 sq mi), and is divided into 14 dong (administrative neighborhoods). Dongdaemun is located in northeastern Seoul, bordering the city districts of Seongbuk to the northwest, Jongno to the west, Seongdong to the south, Gwangjin to the southeast, and Jungnang to the east. Dongdaemun is part of the Seongjeosimni (Outer old Seoul) area and is named after Heunginjimun, one of the Eight Gates of Seoul which is not located within the district. Dongdaemun is home to the University of Seoul, Cheongnyangni station, and to Gyeongdong Market, one of the largest herbal medicine and agricultural markets in South Korea. Yoo Deok-yeol (Ïú†ÎçïÏó¥) of the Democratic Party has been the mayor of Dongdaemun since July 2010.
